Exam Name: 🧠 ISC2 CC Quiz — Domain 3 (Access Control Concepts)
Instructions: Read the questions carefully and select the best answer.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is an example of a security control?
Questions.Explaination: A firewall is a technical security control designed to restrict network traffic.

Questions.Question: What is the definition of an object in the context of access controls?
Choices: A. An entity that responds to a request for service
B. A device with onboard firmware
C. Something that contains its own access control logic
D. Anything that initiates a request for service
Questions.AnswerKey: A. An entity that responds to a request for service
Questions.Explaination: Objects are passive resources that subjects attempt to access.

Questions.Question: Derrick logs on to a system to read a file. In this example, Derrick is the ______.
Questions.Explaination: A subject is an active entity that initiates access.

Questions.Question: Which of the following is a subject?
Questions.Explaination: A user is an active entity requesting access.

Questions.Question: What strategy integrates people, technology, and operations to create multiple layers of protection?
Questions.Explaination: Layered defense (defense in depth) uses multiple controls across layers.

Questions.Question: How does privileged access management implement least privilege?
Choices: A. Restricting access to critical information only
B. Granting maximum access to all users
C. Providing access based on seniority
D. Granting users only what they need
Questions.AnswerKey: D. Granting users only what they need
Questions.Explaination: Least privilege limits access strictly to job requirements.

Questions.Question: In Mandatory Access Control (MAC), what determines access levels?
Choices: A. Government policy and security clearance
Questions.AnswerKey: A. Government policy and security clearance
Questions.Explaination: MAC is centrally enforced and not user-controlled.

Questions.Question: Which is an example of a logical access control?
Questions.Explaination: Logical controls are technical mechanisms enforcing access.

Questions.Question: Limiting access to data on a network is what type of control?
Questions.Explaination: Network access restrictions are technical controls.

Questions.Question: In the seat belt analogy, what is an administrative control?
Choices: B. Passing a law requiring seat belt use
C. Building a car with seat belts
Questions.AnswerKey: B. Passing a law requiring seat belt use
Questions.Explaination: Administrative controls are policies, rules, or laws.

Questions.Question: What alternative control fits when biometric locks are unnecessary and auditing is not required?
Choices: A. Biometric scanners on all doors
Questions.Explaination: Simpler physical controls may be sufficient and proportional.

Questions.Question: Which physical controls share a single point of failure?
Questions.Explaination: Both rely on power, creating a shared failure point.

Questions.Question: Which is an example of a physical access control?
Questions.Explaination: Physical controls protect facilities and environments.

Questions.Question: What challenge do SMBs face with payroll system controls?
Choices: B. Insufficient personnel for separation of duties
Questions.AnswerKey: B. Insufficient personnel for separation of duties
Questions.Explaination: Smaller staff sizes limit duty separation.

Questions.Question: What do behavioral biometrics measure?
Questions.Explaination: Behavioral biometrics analyze how users behave.

Questions.Question: RBAC works best in which environment?
Choices: B. High turnover with similar access needs
Questions.AnswerKey: B. High turnover with similar access needs
Questions.Explaination: RBAC simplifies management at scale.

Questions.Question: What is the term for inappropriate permission inheritance in RBAC?
Questions.Explaination: Privileges accumulate beyond role needs.

Questions.Question: What is a key feature of just-in-time privileged access?
Questions.Explaination: JIT grants temporary, scoped access.

Questions.Question: Why disable accounts before deletion when employees leave?
Questions.Explaination: Files and logs may still reference the account.

Questions.Question: What is user provisioning?
Choices: A. Managing access to systems and resources
Questions.AnswerKey: A. Managing access to systems and resources
Questions.Explaination: Provisioning handles account creation and access.

Questions.Question: Who can modify rules in a MAC system?
Questions.Explaination: MAC rules are centrally controlled.

Questions.Question: Requiring two people in a data center is called:
Questions.Explaination: Prevents single-person misuse.

Questions.Question: Why is DAC not scalable?
Questions.Explaination: Owner-managed permissions do not scale well.

Questions.Question: What is the two-person rule?
Questions.Explaination: Prevents unauthorized solo activity.

Questions.Question: What must a password be?
Questions.Explaination: Password secrecy is essential.

Questions.Question: Which control prevents tailgating?
Questions.Explaination: Allows only one person at a time.

Questions.Question: Responsibility of admins with privileged accounts?
Questions.Explaination: Privileged admins manage core systems.

Questions.Question: Which is a monitoring tool?
Questions.Explaination: Cameras provide surveillance and monitoring.
